intro: Cantharospermum albicans, commonly known as white flame tree, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Bignoniaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with opposite arrangement and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking floral display and adaptability to various soil types. The species is also noted for its ability to thrive in full sun and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
